title: 112_hr4265
content: The Act is titled the "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act" and includes a provision for a surtax on millionaires contingent on the passage of a balanced budget amendment or spending limit amendment. This surtax would be added to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. For taxable years between 2012 and 2023, non-corporate taxpayers face a 5% tax on income exceeding $1,000,000. This tax is in addition to existing taxes and is part of the "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act". For taxable years between 2012 and 2023, non-corporate taxpayers face a 5% tax on income exceeding $1,000,000. This tax is in addition to existing taxes and is part of the "Shared Responsibility in Preserving America's Future Act." The tax amount is adjusted annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year, rounding up to the nearest multiple of $10,000 if necessary. For taxable years between 2012 and 2023, non-corporate taxpayers face a 5% tax on income exceeding $1,000,000, adjusted annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. Threshold amounts are rounded up to the next highest multiple of $10,000. Married individuals filing separately have a threshold amount of one-half. Modified adjusted gross income is calculated by reducing adjusted gross income by the excess of gross income from a non-passive trade or business. The IRS imposes a 5% tax on non-corporate taxpayers' income over $1,000,000 between 2012 and 2023. The tax is applicable to non-passive trade or business income where the taxpayer pays wages to at least one full-time equivalent employee. Regulations will be prescribed by the Secretary. The IRS imposes a 5% tax on non-corporate taxpayers' income over $1,000,000 between 2012 and 2023. Regulations similar to section 469(l) will determine the income considered. Special rules apply to nonresident alien individuals and citizens/residents living abroad. The tax amount under subsection (a) is reduced by the excess of amounts excluded from gross income under section 911 over deductions or exclusions disallowed under section 911(d)(6). Subsection (a) does not apply to charitable trusts with interests devoted to specific purposes under section 170(c)(2)(B). The tax imposed under this section is not considered as tax imposed by this chapter for certain purposes, such as determining credits or for section 55. Additionally, the application of this section is contingent on a Balanced Budget or Spending Limit Amendment. The United States has proposed a balanced budget or spending limit amendment to the Constitution for ratification by the States. If not certified by the President before September 30, 2012, this section will not apply to any taxable year. Ratification of the amendment is required for this section to take effect. The proposed balanced budget or spending limit amendment to the Constitution must be ratified by the States before December 31, 2017 to take effect. A clerical amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Section 15 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 will not be affected by the amendment on the surtax for millionaires. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2012.
